results.title: Movement in time and space
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Discovery and Experience”.
The outside world consists of experiences rather than objects, to the young child. Socialisation of the school child takes place only after a series of explorations and discoveries about being a person. Music, movement, and drama once considered recreational functions, are now regarded as ways of exploring space, time and personality.

results.brief_description: Shows the techniques of movement exploration, demonstrating locomotor activities, ball handling, spatial awareness, uses for hula hoops, jump ropes, apparatus stations, and a technique for use with limited apparatus.

results.title: Movement and moving the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Illustrates movement within the frame, movement of the frame and movement of the camera. Notes the creation of the sense of movement without moving the frame, and how and when the camera can be used subjectively. Narrated by Peter Thompson.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
One of a series aimed to improve the viewer’s awareness of movement in photography as a creative medium and to increase their understanding of visual options. Several photographers discuss their techniques and show pictures of their style, including Ernst Haas, famous for his highly original colour photographs.

results.title: Mouth to mouth (AFC)
results.creator_credit: John Sainken, Vega Film Productions, Victorian Film Corporation and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Two teenage girls escape from a youth training centre and head for the city finding work in a food bar. Eventually they end up sharing a derelict warehouse with two unemployed boys they have met, one from an Italian family and the other from the country, and for awhile the openness and warmth of their relationships transcend their depressing economic circumstances. This is a film about survival, interpersonal relationships and the inevitable disintegration of the group. Cast includes Kim Krejus, Sonia Peat, Ian Gilmour, Sergio Frazetto. Cinematography by Tow Cowan; Nigel Buesst as camera assistant.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.
